summary: Edwin J Lopez was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list his position, annual salary, and gross pay for the specified accounting periods. The consistent appearance of his name across these documents indicates his sustained employment with the HSCA during this timeframe.
significance: Edwin J Lopez's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the documents do not specify his exact role within the committee, his presence on payroll and certification reports confirms his involvement in the HSCA's operations during its investigation.
